Patients needing to lose a lot of weight quickly are sometimes recommended these diets by their doctors, however not everybody can do them safely. We'll be focusing on some of the features of very low calorie diets in this article.

One thing you should know about very low calorie diets is that they can have side effects. When you embark on a new diet, by severely cutting calories, you may have adverse reactions. A couple of the ill effects may include fatigue, bowel issues or nausea. There have been known cases where gallstones build with extreme, rapid weight reduction; most likely caused by the pace with which the weight dropped off. If you go on such a diet and experience any serious side effects, you should keep your doctor informed concerning your symptoms. From research there have been no proven benefits of going on a very low calorie diet when compared with just a low calorie diet. The
regular low calorie diet lets you consume anywhere between 800 and 1500 calories every day, while a very low calorie diet will keep you below 800 calories. Fluid loss usually accounts for the great amount of weight lost initially with a very low calorie diet. It was found in a study that after a few months the effectiveness of a very low calorie diet wasn't any better than a low calorie diet for losing weight. A VLCD, furthermore, often has unpleasant side effects, including fatigue, dry skin, hair loss and headaches, to name a few. For those wanting to simply lose weight, a low calorie diet would be the more comfortable option, even though a VLCD might be best for somebody with underlying medical conditions.

The dangerous thing about very low calorie diets is that they're appealing to not just obese people but to people who have eating disorders, like anorexia nervosa. This condition is where people really want to be thin and their view of themselves is very distorted. To people with these types of eating disorders they'll look fat, whilst to other people they will look very emaciated. These people will usually not eat anything but foods that are very low calorie, and nutritional deficiencies can be a result of this, bringing along many side effects such as hair problems, nail problems, depression and hypothermia, caused by their body temperature being lower than it should, making them feel cold. If you see someone on a very low calorie diet who already looks too thin, you should try to get them to seek help. There can be some benefits to very low calorie diets, especially for anyone who is extremely overweight and has medical problems because of this. Dehydration and malnutrition are some of the side effects and there are risks involved with such a diet, so getting medical supervision whilst on this diet is recommended.

It was found in a study that after a few months the effectiveness of a very low calorie diet wasn't any better than a low calorie diet for losing weight. A VLCD, furthermore, often has unpleasant side effects, including fatigue, dry skin, hair loss and headaches, to name a few. For those wanting to simply lose weight, a low calorie diet would be the more comfortable option, even though a VLCD might be best for somebody with underlying medical conditions.

The Cambridge Diet is a very low calorie diet that was developed in England in the 1970s. Due to you receiving foods that are pre-packaged on this diet, your calorie intake will be low in addition to having all of the essential nutrition you need calculated for you. These are in the form of shakes, soups and meal bars. Even though this diet has been in existence for a while, and a lot of people have had success on it, it does carry some disadvantages. You must drink plenty of water to avoid being dehydrated, and you can only do exercise at a very low intensity. Also, eating packaged meals every day can become tiresome for many people. Before going on a diet like the Cambridge Diet you need to consult your doctor to find out whether it's safe for you. Very low calorie diets can carry benefits, especially in those people who are very overweight and as a result of this have medical problems. At the same time, it's not usually a good idea to go on such a diet without medical supervision, as there are some risks involved, such as side effects, malnutrition and dehydration.
